etymology.description: ⿰革(gé, "leather") + 勹(​bāo, "wrap") (phonetic) + 米(mǐ, "rice") = brew using wrapped leather and rice -> early form of 麴(麴) (qū, "starter with brewer's yeast")
etymology.interpretation: 鞠(jū, "brew") combines the phonetic elements associated with leather and wrapping, suggested by ⿰革勹, with the semantic 米(mǐ, "rice"), highlighting its use in fermentation processes involving rice.

examples.chinese: 仲夏夜里(仲夏夜裡)，工匠鞠药酒(工匠鞠藥酒)。
examples.english: On a midsummer night, the craftsman brews medicinal wine.

examples.chinese: 老农每年都会在秋收后鞠佳酒(老農每年都會在秋收後鞠佳酒)。
examples.pinyin: Lǎonóng měi nián dōu huì zài qiūshōu hòu jū jiājiǔ.
examples.english: Every year, the old farmer brews fine wine after the harvest.
